definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Job growth may also set loose what economists call “shadow demand”.
sentences.chinese: 就業增加也許能刺激經濟學家口中的“影子需求”。

sentences.english: The new standardwas set according to what economists call purchasing power parity.
sentences.chinese: 新的標準是根據經濟學家所說的購買力平價而設定的。

sentences.english: To a first approximation, the non-economist's answers violate fundamental economic logic.
sentences.chinese: 大致上，非經濟學家的答案違反了基本的經濟邏輯。

sentences.english: Wall Street economists had expected that the number would drop to 455, 000.
sentences.chinese: 華爾街經濟學家原以爲那個數字會將到45萬5千的。

sentences.english: Economists who ignore the recent rise in unemployment deserve to lose their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 忽視最近失業增加經濟學家們，活該丟掉飯碗。

sentences.english: Mr. Wu Jinglian, a renowned economist, concurs with it.
sentences.chinese: 著名經濟學家吳敬璉先生就是這種看法。

sentences.english: Other economists have more confidence that the economy is self-equilibrating.
sentences.chinese: 其它經濟學家們則更加相信經濟可以自我平衡。

sentences.english: The financial sector dominates non-academic employment of professional economists.
sentences.chinese: 在金融部門裏充滿了不從事學術研究的職業經濟學家。

sentences.english: Economists find it devilishly hard to define the “correct value” for a currency.
sentences.chinese: 經濟學家發現給貨幣定義“正確的價值”難於上青天。

sentences.english: The right trade theory was put forward by famous economist Dales.
sentences.chinese: 排污權交易理論是由著名經濟學家戴爾斯提出的。

sentences.english: That was less than the median estimate of 55 in a Bloomberg News survey of 13 economists.
sentences.chinese: 比彭博資訊13位經濟學家調查預測中值爲55要少。

sentences.english: First Rafael Correa, the leftist economist, won the presidency.
sentences.chinese: 首先拉斐爾科雷亞，左派經濟學家，贏得總統寶座。

sentences.english: In many ways I am a prototypical economist.
sentences.chinese: 在很多方面我都是一個典型的經濟學家。

sentences.english: Or economists, when all their predictions have just gone up in smoke.
sentences.chinese: 當所有預測都灰飛煙滅時，經濟學家們也會這麼說。

sentences.english: Cao expedites the forecast obtains the auspicious silver China chief economist Wang Tao's approval.
sentences.chinese: 曹遠征的預測得到瑞銀中國首席經濟學家汪濤的認同。

sentences.english: Not Nita chief macro economic scientist Ma Qing expressed.
sentences.chinese: 莫尼塔首席宏觀經濟學家馬青表示。

definition: Asian area/the Far East/Asia Pacific region
vice-chairman (of an organization)/vice president (of a company)/deputy governor (of a bank)
head/director (of an organizational unit)/(police) commissioner/inspector-general/rank of local governor in Tang dynasty administration
